title: 110_hr3678
content: The "Internet Tax Freedom Act Amendments Act of 2007" changes the moratorium on internet taxes to extend until 2014. States that currently tax internet access are grandfathered in. The Internet Tax Freedom Act Amendments Act of 2007 extends the moratorium on internet taxes until 2014. Section 1104 of the Act defines 'Internet access' for taxation purposes, with exceptions until June 30, 2008. The Internet Tax Freedom Act Amendments Act of 2007 extends the moratorium on internet taxes until 2014. It defines 'Internet access' for taxation purposes, with exceptions until June 30, 2008. No inference of legislative construction shall be drawn from this subsection or the amendments made by the Act for any period prior to June 30, 2008, with respect to any tax subject to specific exceptions. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. Section 1105 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to define "Internet access" as a service enabling users to connect to the Internet and access content. This includes telecommunications used to provide the service and incidental services like email and instant messaging. The amendment to the Internet Tax Freedom Act defines "Internet access" as a service that allows users to connect to the Internet and access content, including telecommunications and incidental services like email and instant messaging. The amendment excludes voice, audio, or video programming, as well as other products and services that utilize Internet protocol and have a separate charge. The amendment to the Internet Tax Freedom Act clarifies that the term 'tax on Internet access' does not include certain State taxes on commercial activity or gross income. The Internet Tax Freedom Act amendment specifies criteria for taxes enacted between 2005 and 2007, or between 1932 and 1936, that replace certain types of taxes, are broad-based, and non-discriminatory towards communication services. The amendment allows states to modify certain taxes after November 1, 2007, as long as the changes do not significantly limit the scope of the tax. No conclusions about previous tax applications can be drawn from this amendment. SEC. 5 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to include changes related to telecommunications services and enabling users to access content over the Internet. Additionally, section 1108 is removed. SEC. 6 addresses the sunset of grandfather provisions. SEC. 6 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act addresses the sunset of grandfather provisions, stating that certain states are exempt from taxes on Internet access if they have repealed such taxes more than 24 months prior to the enactment of this provision. SEC. 7 specifies that the Act and its amendments will take effect on November 1, 2007.
